playbooks.title: Enable Network Intelligence Safely
playbooks.summary: Step-by-step guide to enabling Guardian's network intelligence features while maintaining security and compliance standards.

sections.heading: Why this matters
sections.body:
Network intelligence provides visibility into network topology, traffic patterns, and anomalies. Enabling it safely ensures you maintain compliance while gaining operational benefits.

**Key benefits:**
- Real-time network visibility
- Anomaly detection and alerting
- Traffic analysis and optimization

sections.heading: Prerequisites
sections.body:
Before enabling network intelligence, ensure:
- Network isolation requirements are understood
- Compliance team approval is obtained
- Data retention policies are defined
- Network monitoring tools are prepared

sections.heading: Step-by-step implementation
sections.body:
1. **Access Network Settings**: Navigate to Guardian Admin → Network → Intelligent Monitoring
2. **Review Security Posture**: Run the pre-flight security check (takes ~5 minutes)
3. **Configure Data Retention**: Set retention policy (default: 30 days)
4. **Enable Gradual Rollout**: Start with 10% of network traffic, monitor, increase to 100%
5. **Set Up Alerts**: Configure network anomaly thresholds and notification channels
6. **Monitor Dashboard**: Check Network Intelligence Dashboard daily for first week

sections.heading: Common pitfalls
sections.body:
**Pitfall 1: Enabling at 100% immediately**
- Causes: Risk of overwhelming alerting system
- Solution: Use gradual rollout feature (10% → 30% → 100%)

**Pitfall 2: Insufficient data retention planning**
- Causes: Storage costs, compliance violations
- Solution: Align retention with compliance requirements before enabling

**Pitfall 3: Missing alert configuration**
- Causes: Important anomalies go unnoticed
- Solution: Configure baseline thresholds using first week of data

playbooks.title: Improve Overall Readiness Foundation
playbooks.summary: Foundational steps to increase Guardian's overall readiness score from low to moderate levels.

sections.heading: Understanding readiness
sections.body:
Guardian readiness score measures how well your organization is prepared to use advanced Guardian features.

**Readiness score breakdown:**
- **0-30**: Foundation needed (basic setup incomplete)
- **30-60**: Growing foundation (core capabilities active)
- **60-80**: Solid readiness (most features leveraged)
- **80-100**: Expert readiness (all capabilities optimized)

sections.heading: Quick wins to improve readiness
sections.body:
✓ Enable all core detection modules (takes 15 minutes)
✓ Configure at least 3 alert channels (takes 20 minutes)
✓ Set up executive dashboard (takes 10 minutes)
✓ Complete team onboarding for 5+ users (takes 30 minutes)
✓ Run compliance baseline report (takes 5 minutes)

sections.heading: Implementation roadmap
sections.body:
**Week 1: Foundation (Target: 40-50 readiness)**
- Day 1-2: Enable core detection modules
- Day 3-4: Configure alert channels and thresholds
- Day 5: Team training and initial onboarding

**Week 2-4: Expansion (Target: 50-70 readiness)**
- Set up integration with SIEM
- Configure advanced threat hunting dashboards
- Establish incident response workflows

**Week 5-8: Optimization (Target: 70+ readiness)**
- Fine-tune detection rules based on 4 weeks of data
- Implement automated response actions
- Complete executive reporting setup

sections.heading: Measuring progress
sections.body:
**Track these metrics weekly:**
- Overall readiness score (target: +5 points/week)
- Number of active detection rules (target: 90%+)
- Alert volume and quality (target: <10% false positives)
- Team adoption (target: 80%+ monthly active users)

playbooks.title: Increase Adoption Across Teams
playbooks.summary: Drive consistent Guardian adoption by breaking adoption barriers and building team champions.

sections.heading: Understanding adoption challenges
sections.body:
Low adoption typically stems from:
- **Knowledge gaps**: Teams don't understand Guardian capabilities
- **Integration friction**: Guardian tools don't fit existing workflows
- **Alert fatigue**: Too many alerts → teams ignore them
- **Lack of ownership**: No clear champion responsible for adoption

**This playbook addresses all four challenges.**

sections.heading: Phase 1: Build awareness (Week 1-2)
sections.body:
1. Identify team champions (1-2 per team)
2. Conduct department-level demo sessions (30 min each)
3. Share Guardian value prop docs: 'Guardian in 5 Minutes' guide
4. Set up Slack/Teams integration for quick tips
5. Create usage dashboard visible to all teams

sections.heading: Phase 2: Enable workflows (Week 3-4)
sections.body:
1. Map Guardian features to team workflows
2. Customize dashboards for each team's use case
3. Set up team-specific alert channels
4. Create team playbooks (incident response, threat hunting, compliance)
5. Schedule 1-on-1 onboarding with key users

sections.heading: Phase 3: Drive engagement (Week 5-8)
sections.body:
1. Run weekly 'Guardian Tips' sessions
2. Share wins: 'Threat caught by team X', 'Incident resolved in 10 minutes'
3. Implement Guardian adoption metrics in team OKRs
4. Reward top adopters (recognition, swag)
5. Monthly town halls showcasing team usage

sections.heading: Success metrics
sections.body:
**Measure adoption with:**
- % of team members with >2 logins/month (target: 75%+)
- % of teams using Guardian dashboards (target: 90%+)
- Avg. incident detection-to-response time (target: <30 min)
- NPS for Guardian (target: >40)

playbooks.title: Create Executive Reporting Cadence
playbooks.summary: Establish monthly executive reports to demonstrate Guardian ROI and drive organizational alignment.

sections.heading: Why executive reporting matters
sections.body:
Executive reports demonstrate:
- **Security value**: Threats detected and mitigated
- **Operational efficiency**: MTTR improvements, incident volume trends
- **Compliance posture**: Coverage gaps closed, audit readiness
- **Investment justification**: ROI from Guardian deployment

sections.heading: Monthly report components
sections.body:
Every executive report should include:

1. **Executive Summary** (1 page)
   - Key metrics: Threats detected, incidents resolved, MTTR
   - Month-over-month trends
   - Critical highlights or concerns

2. **Threat Landscape** (1 page)
   - Top threats detected this month
   - Attack vectors, affected assets
   - Response actions taken

3. **Operational Metrics** (1 page)
   - Team adoption and engagement
   - Alert accuracy and false positive rate
   - Incident handling statistics

4. **Compliance & Coverage** (1 page)
   - Compliance gaps addressed
   - Detection coverage by asset class
   - Audit readiness status

sections.heading: Create first report
sections.body:
1. Access Guardian Dashboard → Reports → Executive Summary
2. Select date range (e.g., last 30 days)
3. Customize sections relevant to leadership (security/ops/compliance focus)
4. Add insights: Notable trends, team highlights, forward recommendations
5. Export as PDF or schedule monthly delivery
6. Distribute to leadership team by 5th of month

sections.heading: Sustain cadence
sections.body:
**To maintain consistent reporting:**
- Set calendar reminder for report generation (1st of month)
- Assign one owner to customize each month
- Track recommendations from previous reports
- Share highlights with broader teams (builds visibility)
- Adjust metrics based on leadership feedback
